Job.Title: Pianist
Job.Description: She will play the piano for the customers.

LoseTrait.Text: ${name} seems to finally be getting over her shyness. She's not always so Nervous anymore.
Playing in front of a crowd has allowed ${name} to finally overcome her Shyness.

GainTrait.Text: ${name} has become an Idol, adored by her fans and followers.

LoseTrait.Text: Having exercised her fine motor skills so much playing the piano, ${name} has lost her Clumsiness.
Playing a musical instrument for so long, ${name} managed to overcome her Tone-Deafness.

GainTrait.Text: Playing the piano has given ${name} an Elegant nature.

Message.Name: work
Message.Text: ${name} played the piano in the bar.

Message.Name: refuse
Message.Text: ${name} refused to play piano in your bar to${shift}.

Message.Name: refuse.horny
Message.Text: ${name} let lust get the better of her, and she ended up missing her ${shift} shift.

Messages.Message: She plays with the grace of an angel. Customers come from miles around to listen to her play. ${name}'s playing brought many patrons to tears as she played a song full of sadness. Nice melody fills the room when ${name} is behind the piano. Knowing that she is good, ${name} played all the tunes blindfolded. Being confident in her skill, ${name} played today using only one hand. ${name}'s soothing playing seems to glide over the noise and bustling of the bar.

She's unbelievable at this and is always getting praised by the customers for her playing skills. Her playing fills the room. Some customers hum the melody under their noses. After making a mistake she improvised a passage to the next song. She plays without music sheets having all the songs memorized. ${name}'s soothing playing seems to glide over the noise and bustling of the bar.
${name} began to acquire her own following - a small crowd of people came in just to listen to her and buy drinks

Her playing is really good and gets praised by the customers often. Her playing was pleasing, if bland. Her rhythm was nice, if slightly untrained. ${name} doesn't have any trouble playing the piano. Give ${name} any kind of music sheet and she will play it. She is really good at this. When asked to play one of the more complicated tunes she gave her all. The slow song ${name} played at the end of shift really had her full emotion and heart.

She hits a few right notes but she still has room to improve. While she won't win any contests, ${name} isn't a terrible pianist. ${name}'s performance today was good. She is a promising pianist. She gets the key order right most of the time. You could tell that there was something like a melody, but ${name} still needs a lot of practice.
The slow song ${name} played at the end of shift really had her full emotion and heart. A pity that she felt so bored and tired.

She almost never hits a right note. Lucky for you most of the customers are too drunk and horny to care. She is terrible at this. Some customers left after she started to play. You could count on the fingers of one hand the part in her performance that was clean. She is bad at playing the piano. ${name} knows a note. Too bad it's the only one she knows and plays it over and over.
Her playing is barely acceptable, but fortunately the bustling of the bar drowns ${name} out for the most part.

She didn't play the piano so much as banged on it.
Her audience seems paralyzed, as if they couldn't believe that a piano was capable of making such noise.
After ten seconds you wanted to grab an axe and end the instrument's misery under ${name}'s attempt to play.
Nobody else would call this random key-mashing 'playing', but ${name} thinks otherwise. When ${name} started to play, the bar emptied almost instantly. This could be useful in a fire. ${name} banged on the piano clearly having no clue which note was which.

Message.Name: post-work-text
Message.Text: Stunned by her beauty a customer left her a great tip.
She used her Psychic skills to know exactly what the patrons wanted to hear her play.
Message.Group:
<Text Condition="Performance<150"> A patron bumped into the piano causing her to miss a note. This pissed her off and using her Assassin skills she killed him before even thinking about it, resulting in patrons fleeing the building.
A patron bumped into the piano, but with her skill she didn't miss a note. The patron was lucky to leave with his life.
Message.Text: Her clumsy nature caused her to close the lid on her fingers making her have to stop playing for a few hours.
Message.Group:
<Text Condition="Performance<150"> Her pessimistic mood depressed the customers making them tip less.
${name} was in a poor mood so the patrons gave her a bigger tip to try and cheer her up.

<Text Condition="Performance<150"> ${name} was in a cheerful mood but the patrons thought she needed to work more on her on her playing.
Her optimistic mood made patrons cheer up increasing the amount they tip.

<Text Condition="Performance<160"> "A patron gasped at her Horrific Scars making her uneasy. But $[he|she] didn't feel sorry for her.
A patron gasped at her Horrific Scars making her sad. Feeling bad about it as she played so well, they left a good tip.
